title: Retaking of the Jaffar Express: Pak forces kill all ‘terrorists’; 21 hostages slain by BLA
content: Pakistan's military killed all Baloch Liberation Army terrorists and freed 300 hostages in Balochistan. The militant group hijacked the Jaffar Express train. The operation left 21 hostages dead due to militant actions. The train had over 450 passengers including security personnel. The terrorists were in contact with their leaders in Afghanistan.

title: After bikes, booze: White House whines about whiskey exports to India
content: Despite India's recent reduction of tariffs on American bourbon, the Trump administration insists the 100% duty is still unhelpful. The White House highlights that this discrepancy impacts US spirits market expansion, emphasizing the need for fair treatment of American businesses globally.

title: How Pak forces rescued hostages used as human shields in train siege
content: Pakistan's security forces freed hostages and eliminated 33 militants involved in a train hijacking in Balochistan. The militants derailed the Jaffar Express, killing 21 passengers and four soldiers. The coordinated rescue operation took nearly 24 hours and ensured the safety of all passengers. The government promises to deal with all facilitators of these terrorists.

title: Ranya Rao smuggling case: K'taka govt withdraws CID probe into police role
content: The Karnataka government withdrew the CID probe into police involvement in the Ranya Rao gold smuggling case. A Bengaluru court reserved its bail plea verdict for March 14, with allegations of procedural lapses during her arrest, while the DRI disputed such claims. Gold worth ₹12.56 crore was seized from her.

title: Nithin Kamath said Zerodha users drop in 15 years; Groww may just agree
content: Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath revealed that the company is experiencing its first business slowdown in 15 years. A decline in active users across major stock broking platforms signifies a broader market correction. According to National Stock Exchange (NSE) data, eight of the top 10 broking firms saw a decline in active investors in February.  Kamath noted a 30% drop in trading activity due to market conditions and regulatory changes.

title: Digital Aadhaar shields Kashmir’s Chinars from axe of greed
content: Kashmir's Chinar trees are being digitally tagged with unique numbers and QR codes by the J&K Forest Research Institute to track and monitor their health and presence. This initiative aims to combat illegal felling and urbanization threats. So far, 28,560 Chinars have been recorded, including some of the oldest and largest in Asia.

title: J&K arms licence scam: MHA denies nod for 3 IAS officers prosecution
content: The ministry of home affairs has returned a proposal to prosecute three IAS officers in the Jammu and Kashmir arms licences scam due to missing documents. They must resubmit the full documentation within a week. CBI is investigating irregularities in granting over 278,000 arms licences between 2012 and 2016, implicating several IAS officers for issuing licences in exchange for money.

title: JPMorgan Chase CEO: I respect people who don't want to go to office... but then...
content: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon defended the bank's strict return-to-office mandate, requiring employees to return five days a week, starting March. He emphasized that company decisions prioritize clients and overall business over individual preferences. Despite significant pushback from employees, particularly the technology workforce, Dimon remains firm on the policy, potentially risking talent retention.

title: Soldier hit by bullet from across LoC in J&K’s Rajouri
content: An Indian Army soldier stationed at the Line of Control in Jammu and Kashmir was injured by cross-border firing from Pakistan in the Rajouri district. The incident occurred at Kalsiyan of Nowshera sector. Another explosion took place in the Poonch district later, though no casualties were reported.

title: Halal vs Malhar: What is the row that has rocked Maharashtra politics?
content: A political controversy has started in Maharashtra over the government's new 'Malhar Certification' initiative. Minister Nitesh Rane launched this certification for Hindu meat traders to ensure shops are 100% Hindu-owned and free from adulteration. Opposition leaders have criticised the move, calling it divisive and unconstitutional. Rane defended the initiative, focusing on ensuring quality and promoting Hindu-owned businesses.

title: Donald Trump makes a 'Big Tesla Terrorism' announcement, says 'I will ...'
content: Republican lawmakers are calling for investigations into recent vandalism targeting Tesla showrooms and charging stations. President Donald Trump supports these measures, suggesting that such acts could be labeled as domestic terrorism. House Speaker Mike Johnson announced Congress will work with the Justice Department and FBI to address the incidents.

title: Trump tests ethical boundaries by buying Tesla to bail out Musk
content: US President Donald Trump purchased a Tesla Model S to support Elon Musk amid declining Tesla stock and attacks on the company. Trump praised Musk for his dedication and suggested labeling attackers of Tesla as 'domestic terrorists.' Following his gesture, Tesla stock rose by 7% and Musk committed to doubling US production within two years.

title: Will Jayson Tatum play tonight agianst the OKC Thunder?
content: Jayson Tatum is questionable for the Boston Celtics' game against the Oklahoma City Thunder on March 12. His absence would be a significant blow due to injuries to other key players. The game is scheduled for 7:30 p.m. ET, and fans are eagerly awaiting updates on Tatum’s status, which could be crucial for the Celtics.

title: 'Such acts won't shake Pak’s resolve for peace': PM Sharif on train hijack
content: Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif condemned the Jaffar Express hijacking by Baloch Liberation Army, calling it a cowardly act that won't deter the nation's resolve for peace. The attack resulted in the death of several hostages and militants, with ongoing rescue operations saving 190 passengers so far.

title: 'Stamp of approval': BJP vows development after sweeping Haryana civic polls
content: The BJP secured a sweeping victory in Haryana’s civic polls, winning key cities like Ambala, Faridabad, and Gurugram. CM Nayab Singh Saini called the results a public endorsement of the "triple-engine government" driving rapid development. He reaffirmed PM Modi’s vision of a "Viksit Bharat" by 2047 and pledged to fulfill the BJP’s poll promise, including financial aid for women under the 'Lado Lakshmi Yojana.'

title: 'Thank You Pakistan': ICC lauds PCB for successful Champions Trophy
content: The ICC praised the Pakistan Cricket Board for successfully hosting the ICC Men's Champions Trophy 2025, marking Pakistan's first ICC event since 1996. India won the tournament, which saw 15 matches played across Karachi, Lahore, Rawalpindi and Dubai. The event showcased Pakistan's passion for cricket and ability to host global events, drawing fans worldwide.

title: Connor McDavid’s frustration sparks debate over his leadership
content: Connor McDavid, captain of the Edmonton Oilers, is facing criticism from fans after showing frustration during a loss to the Buffalo Sabres. Fans are questioning his leadership, blaming poor team direction and netminding. Some fans also criticize head coach Kris Knoblauch for not calling a timeout. The Oilers are preparing to face the New Jersey Devils next.

title: TTP, BLA, ISK, Taliban: Will Pakistan succumb to 'Quad of terror'?
content: Pakistan is experiencing a severe security crisis, fighting four interconnected militant groups: Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan, Balochistan Liberation Army, Islamic State Khorasan, and the influence of the Afghan Taliban. Terrorism-related deaths and attacks have surged, leading to significant instability and geopolitical concerns, including threats to Chinese investments. The country must urgently adapt its counterterrorism strategy to maintain stability.

title: Nasa's Sunita Williams finally returning to Earth
content: NASA and SpaceX are launching the Crew-10 mission today to the ISS, carrying astronauts from NASA, JAXA, and Roscosmos. This mission will also bring back NASA's Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore, who were stranded in space for eight months due to technical issues with Boeing's Starliner. The mission will focus on scientific research and technological experiments.

title: Ukraine ready for 30-day ceasefire: Will Putin 'tango' with Trump?
content: Ukraine has agreed to a 30-day ceasefire proposed by the US, potentially pausing the three-year war with Russia if Moscow reciprocates. High-stakes negotiations in Saudi Arabia led to Washington resuming military aid to Kyiv. Putin's acceptance remains uncertain, with concerns about Russia's historical ceasefire violations and demands for territorial concessions.

title: 'Don't want to watch the team play': Ex-Pak cricketer slams 'outdated' style
content: Former Pakistan cricketer Imad Wasim has criticised Pakistan's outdated playing style following their poor performance in the ICC Champions Trophy. He highlighted that modern cricket requires an aggressive approach and that Pakistan has failed to adapt. Imad warned that continuing to play cautiously would result in losing fan interest and called for a complete overhaul of their cricketing approach.

title: 'Saffron policy': CM Stalin blasts NEP, vows to fight 'BJP's fascism'
content: Tamil Nadu CM M K Stalin criticized the National Education Policy, calling it a "saffron policy" designed to promote Hindi over regional languages, particularly Tamil. "National Education Policy is not education policy; it is saffron policy. The policy is not created to develop India but to develop Hindi. We are opposing the policy as it would destroy the Tamil Nadu education system completely," Stalin said.

title: 'Hasina coming back as PM': Why Awami League leader thanked India
content: Senior Awami League leader Rabbi Alam has claimed that Sheikh Hasina will return as the prime minister of Bangladesh. He thanked India for providing a safe haven for Hasina, who fled last year after violent clashes. Mohammed Yunus led the interim government and sought Hasina's extradition, which India hasn't officially responded to yet.

title: 'Felt like doomsday': Survivors recall BLA's terrifying attack on Pak train
content: Survivors of the Jaffar Express attack by the Balochistan Liberation Army recounted the horror of being hijacked and enduring intense gunfire. The female and elderly were spared, while security personnel and Punjabis were targeted. Security forces rescued 190 hostages from the 450 passengers. Violence has escalated in Balochistan against non-Baloch Pakistanis, with the BLA intensifying attacks.

title: 'ICC showed us the mirror': Akmal says Pak didn't deserve stage presence at CT ceremony
content: Former Pakistan cricketer Kamran Akmal criticised the absence of a Pakistani representative during the ICC Champions Trophy prize distribution, attributing it to the team's subpar performance. The PCB lodged a complaint with the ICC, but officials defended the protocol, stating that it did not require the presence of the tournament director on stage.

title: Mahmudullah announces retirement from international cricket
content: Mahmudullah, a celebrated Bangladeshi cricketer, has announced his retirement from international cricket, capping a 17-year career. He expressed gratitude to his supporters and family in his announcement. Notably, Mahmudullah holds the distinction of being the only Bangladeshi to score three centuries in ODI World Cups.

title: 'Entire world will wear bhagwa': UP CM says Saffron is his identity
content: Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath expressed his pride in wearing saffron attire, predicting its global acceptance. He spoke on the Sambhal mosque controversy, stressing the historical significance of the Vishnu temple predating Islam and questioned opposition leaders' commitment to preserving cultural and religious heritage.

title: Ranya Rao gold case: BJP shares photo to back Cong link claim
content: BJP leader Amit Malviya shared a photo linking Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah with actress Ranya Rao, who is accused in a gold smuggling case. Malviya took a dig at Deputy CM DK Shivakumar, who had earlier denied any political connection to the case, further escalating tensions.

title: After 300 yrs, Dalit families enter Gidheshwar Shiv Temple in Bengal
content: Dalit families in a West Bengal village have been allowed to worship at the Gidheshwar Shiv Temple for the first time in nearly 300 years, breaking a significant caste barrier. Despite initial resistance and economic boycotts, intervention by local authorities facilitated this historic event.

title: 'Only 18 of 68 sites found': CM Yogi hints at more excavations in Sambhal
content: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath urged people to stop glorifying foreign invaders, stressing the importance of preserving religious sites like Sambhal. Speaking in Lucknow, he emphasized the need to respect places of worship and criticized those who forcibly occupy them. He also highlighted the significance of the Maha Kumbh and criticized previous administrations for mismanagement.

title: Happy Holi 2025: Best messages, quotes, wishes and images to share
content: Holi celebrates the triumph of righteousness and the arrival of spring, marked by mythological significance and vibrant traditions. The festival includes the burning of negativity on Holika Dahan and joyous color play on Rangwali Holi. Celebrations vary across India, fostering unity and new beginnings. Holi is celebrated over two days, each with its own special rituals.

title: Inspired by 'Drishya', man kills woman, dumps body in garbage
content: A Bengaluru electrician, Lakshman, has been arrested for murdering a 50-year-old woman, D Mary, to rob her gold ornaments worth Rs 4 lakh. Inspired by a Kannada movie to destroy evidence, he disposed of her body in a dumpyard. Police tracked him through call records, leading to his confession and recovery of the skeletal remains.

title: Watch: How Baloch insurgents blew up tracks, hijacked Pak train
content: The Baloch Liberation Army hijacked a passenger train in Pakistan's Balochistan province, detonating an explosive to halt the train and taking passengers hostage. Pakistani security forces managed to rescue 155 passengers, while 27 militants were killed in the ensuing standoff. The situation remains critical as insurgents still hold hostages.

title: 'Always wanted to be around Mahi bhai': Samson on bond with Dhoni
content: Sanju Samson, captain of Rajasthan Royals, shares his experiences and admiration for former Indian captain MS Dhoni, while expressing enthusiasm about RR's young talent, Vaibhav Suryavanshi. Samson highlights his evolving relationship with Dhoni and praises 13-year-old Vaibhav's power-hitting abilities and potential in the IPL, boasting his impressive performance and promising future.

title: Haryana 'prof' trying to fly to UK with 7 'students' with fake papers, held
content: A professor from a Haryana university was arrested at Mumbai airport for allegedly using false information to obtain visas for seven youths to the UK under a fake student exchange programme. Police suspect it to be a case of human trafficking and have begun an investigation, with the help of a confession from the professor about his involvement.

title: Pune bus rape case: Accused remanded to judicial custody till March 26
content: Dattatray Gade, accused of raping a 26-year-old woman in a parked MSRTC bus at Pune's Swargate terminus, has been remanded to police custody until March 26. The arrest followed an extensive manhunt with Gade attempting suicide multiple times before being captured. Authorities are investigating security lapses at the terminus, while protests and calls for swift justice continue.

title: Ex-Pak cricketer picks Champions Trophy XI with no Pakistani players
content: Former Pakistan cricketer Basit Ali has revealed his ICC Champions Trophy playing XI, with India's Rohit Sharma as captain. His team focuses on performances in Dubai and differs from the official ICC team. Ali highlighted key performances, especially Sharma's 76 in the final, and included other top players like Virat Kohli and Shreyas Iyer.

title: PM Modi receives Mauritius' highest award; 8 pacts signed
content: During his visit to Mauritius, Prime Minister Narendra Modi was honored with the nation's highest award, dedicating it to the Indian ancestors of Mauritius and all generations. Modi emphasized his commitment to strengthening the India-Mauritius partnership and jointly inaugurated the Atal Bihari Vajpayee Institute of Public Service and Innovation.

title: Retail CPI inflation eases to 7-month low of 3.61% in Feb; Jan IIP growth at 5%
content: Retail inflation in February dropped to a 7-month low of 3.61%. It remains within the RBI's target. Food inflation also saw significant reductions in both rural and urban areas. This decline may encourage the Monetary Policy Committee to cut the repo rate in April to boost GDP growth.

title: World No.1 Shubman Gill crowned ICC Player of the Month
content: Shubman Gill has been named the ICC Men’s Player of the Month for February 2025 after impressive ODI performances, amassing 406 runs in five matches. His stellar displays, including a century against England and a crucial knock in the Champions Trophy, have solidified his position as the world’s top ODI batter.

title: Men's Bracketology: Gonzaga rises with big day for bubble teams on tap
content: The Zags improved their seeding in our projected field of 68 after clinching the WCC tournament title.

title: Rams release Kupp after failing to trade star WR
content: The Rams have officially released Cooper Kupp after failing to find a trade partner for their star wide receiver.

title: Cowboys acquire CB Elam from Bills for picks
content: The Cowboys acquired cornerback Kaiir Elam and a sixth-round draft pick in next month's NFL draft for a pair of picks.

title: Broncos get their TE with 2-year deal for Engram
content: Two-time Pro Bowl tight end Evan Engram, who had 47 catches for 365 yards in an injury-riddled 2024 season with the Jaguars, has a 2-year deal with the Broncos.

title: Allen: I wasn't looking to 'kill' Bills with new deal
content: Josh Allen said he didn't want to negotiate a new deal that would significantly alter the Bills' salary cap.

title: Source: Seahawks to sign WR Valdes-Scantling
content: The Seahawks have agreed to a one-year contract with free agent wide receiver Marquez Valdes-Scantling.

title: Sources: Steelers add Gainwell after Harris' exit
content: Former Eagles running back Kenneth Gainwell has agreed to terms on a one-year deal with the Steelers, league sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: Swanson to miss NWSL start for personal reasons
content: Chicago Stars FC forward Mallory Swanson will miss the start of the 2025 National Women's Soccer League season due to personal reasons, the club confirmed on Wednesday.

title: Koepka says he plans to fulfill contract with LIV
content: Five-time major champion Brooks Koepka pushed back on Fred Couples' recent comments that he was unhappy playing in the LIV Golf League.

title: Champions League live blog: Atléti-Real Madrid, Arsenal-PSV
content: Enjoy live updates from Wednesday's Champions League action as Atlético Madrid take on Real Madrid, Arsenal take on PSV and Aston Villa take on Brugge.

title: Tracking NFL free agency: Live updates on every signing, trade, cut and rumor
content: We're following NFL free agency signings, trades and cuts, with updates on Russell Wilson and Aaron Rodgers.

title: What happens in Vegas: Oregon State punches ticket, UNLV upset to shake up women's Bracketology
content: Champ Week claimed another conference tournament 1-seed when UNLV was upset. But Oregon State's unlikely path to March Madness won the day.

title: From a South Carolina repeat to UConn ending its title drought: Six teams that could win it all
content: Sixty-eight teams will compete in  March Madness. But these six make up the short list of title contenders.

title: NBA Power Rankings: Knicks slip while the Warriors climb
content: Our NBA insiders analyze this week's Power Rankings and assess the health status of all 30 teams with one month remaining in the regular season.

title: How Jacob deGrom is learning to throw smarter, not harder
content: DeGrom hasn't pitched a full season since 2019 -- but the Rangers ace has a plan to make 2025 special.

title: How the SEC became the most dominant conference in college basketball
content: Dwarfed by football no more, the SEC's rise as a men's basketball powerhouse didn't happen overnight.

title: Can anyone stop Scottie Scheffler? Who are some sleeper picks? Previewing the Players storylines
content: From Scheffler's attempt at a three-peat to Colin Morikawa's chances to get back in the winner's circle, we have five big topics to keep an eye on this week.

title: NHL playoff projections: Canucks or Flames for the final Western Conference wild card?
content: The two Pacific Division clubs vying for one spot face off Wednesday night in Alberta. Plus, updated playoff projections, draft lottery outlook, more.

title: Awards Watch: New leaders for Hart, Norris as playoff races heat up
content: With about a month left in the regular season, there are new leaders for league MVP and the best defenseman.

title: Why astronaut Suni Williams runs in space: a 14-billion-year odyssey
content: Suni Williams' eight-day mission turned into a nine-month marathon. Now the astronaut is days away from leaving the International Space Station and returning to Earth.

title: Man Utd CEO: New stadium poses 'risk' to team
content: Manchester United CEO Omar Berrada has admitted the club "risk" falling further behind their rivals while they invest in their new stadium.

title: Atleti's Correa gets 5-match ban for ref insults
content: Atlético Madrid forward Ángel Correa has been handed a five-game ban for insulting the referee after being sent off in the club's 2-1 defeat at Getafe on Sunday.

title: Slot: Loss to PSG 'best game' I've been part of
content: Liverpool head coach Arne Slot described the second leg of his team's Champions League tie with Paris Saint-Germain as the "best game of football" he has been involved in.

title: Alexander-Arnold a doubt for Carabao Cup final
content: Liverpool defender Trent Alexander-Arnold is a doubt for the League Cup final after sustaining an injury in Tuesday's Champions League loss to PSG.

title: Son of ex-Brazil star Marcelo gets Spain U17 call
content: Enzo Alves, son of former Real Madrid and Brazil left back Marcelo, was called up for Spain's under-17 national team on Tuesday.

title: PSV to compensate fans at Arsenal tie after 7-1
content: PSV have announced that they will compensate their fans attending the second leg of their round of 16 Champions League tie at Arsenal on Wednesday.

title: Bayern coach Kompany says Kane 'better with age'
content: Bayern Munich striker Harry Kane earned praise from coach Vincent Kompany on Tuesday after scoring one goal and setting up another in a 2-0 victory at Bayer Leverkusen that saw them book their Champions League quarter-final spot.

title: Labor union says FIFA blocked Azteca inspection
content: An international federation of labor unions said on Tuesday that FIFA denied it access to the Azteca Stadium to inspect conditions of construction workers doing renovations ahead of the 2026 World Cup.

title: Quakes reign could define ex-USMNT boss Arena's complicated legacy
content: Bruce Arena is the greatest American soccer coach in history, but in a career of highs and lows, his Earthquakes job could cement how he's remembered.

title: MMA divisional rankings: How far does Alex Pereira fall at light heavyweight?
content: Here's a look at every weight class to determine the best of the best in UFC, Bellator, PFL and beyond.

title: PFL FAQ: What big changes are coming this year?
content: Who's fighting in the PFL -- and who's not -- in 2025? Here's everything you need to know about the new format.

title: Kings of command: Breakout pitchers to draft
content: Which overlooked pitchers have the skill set to come up with a big season? Tristan H. Cockcroft digs deep into the numbers to present his annual look at MLB's "Kings of Command."

title: Man United's Europa League fate depends on a misfiring attack finding the net
content: Man United's season hinges on advancing in the Europa League, but thanks to their woefully underperforming attack, it's far from guaranteed.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal eye Bayern winger Leroy Sané
content: Arsenal are considering a move to sign Bayern Munich winger Leroy Sané. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Australian GP: All you need to know ahead of the first race of 2025
content: Everything you need to know for the 2025 season-opening Australian Grand Prix at Albert Park in Melbourne.

title: Bell returned to the dirt. Now no one in NASCAR can stop him
content: After his team-imposed ban on dirt racing was lifted, Christopher Bell is back enjoying the hobby he loves, and his NASCAR form has never been better.

title: Family ties: Donovan McNabb Jr. receives offer from Michael Vick, Norfolk State
content: Donovan McNabb Jr. could have the opportunity to play for his dad's former Eagles teammate as Norfolk State became the latest school to make an offer to the 2027 wide receiver.

title: 'Bring the doughnuts': Cavs hilariously stuff Jaylon Tyson's vehicle for failing rookie task
content: The forward didn't deliver the team breakfast as asked, so his teammates replied with a rookie prank.

title: WWE 2K25 review: A solid entry that improves on its predecessor
content: The WWE 2K series has shown steady improvement since its soft relaunch with WWE 2K22 -- and WWE 2K25 is no exception.

title: All Hostages Freed, 28 Soldiers Killed In Pak Train Siege
content: More than 340 train passengers taken hostage by a rebel group were freed Wednesday by security forces after a 30-hour siege, an army official told AFP, confirming that 27 off-duty soldiers were shot by rebels.

title: US Officials Headed To Russia "Right Now": Trump On Ukraine Ceasefire Talks
content: US President Donald Trump said Wednesday that negotiators were headed to Russia "right now" for talks on a possible ceasefire with Ukraine, after Kyiv agreed to a 30-day truce.

title: How Actor Ranya Rao Managed To Give Airport Security The Slip
content: Actor Ranya Rao's gold smuggling racket involved a huge syndicate and she got through airports with the help of the State Protocol Officer who was also part of the racket, the Directorate of Revenue Intelligence or DRI.

title: "National Education Policy Meant To Develop Hindi, Not India": MK Stalin
content: The 'language war' between Tamil Nadu and the centre - the contention that the BJP is trying to impose Hindi on the southern state in the guise of a National Education Policy - continued Wednesday with MK Stalin calling it a plan to develop Hindi.

title: "8 Urns With Bones, Hair": A 'Black Magic' Twist In Lilavati Hospital Fraud
content: The trustees of Mumbai's Lilavati Hospital have made shocking allegations of black magic as the premier healthcare facility made headlines due to a huge misappropriation of funds

title: IndusInd Bank's Damage Control After Rs 2,100 Crore Accounting Lapse
content: IndusInd Bank on Tuesday addressed the fallout of a Rs 2,100 crore discrepancy in accounting, saying it has enough reserves and capital to cover for it.

title: ICC Sends Big Message To PCB Amid Champions Trophy 2025 Ceremony Row
content: The International Cricket Council (ICC) has thanked the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) for successfully hosting the ICC Men's Champions Trophy 2025

title: With Law Students, Medical Grads, How Baloch Liberation Army Ramps Up Violence
content: The BLA claims that the Pakistani military and Punjabi elite are exploiting the region's resources for their own benefit, leaving the local population impoverished and marginalised.

title: "Get In, Patriots": Donald Trump Buys Tesla, Elon Musk Helps Him Pick
content: Donald Trump bought the Tesla in a show of support for Elon Musk's electric vehicle company, which is facing a blowback because of the Tesla CEO's work to advance the President's political agenda.

title: "Not Happy The Way He...": Shreyas Iyer Receives Blunt Verdict By WC Winner
content: Shreyas Iyer finished as India's top run-scorer in the competition with 243 runs in five games, including successive half-centuries against Pakistan and New Zealand in the group stage

title: US Man In Bed With Girlfriend Shot After Dog Jumps On Bed, Sets Off Gun
content: An American dog owner was shot by his pet after it jumped on his bed and set off a loaded gun, police said Wednesday.

title: 50 Years Later, US Murder Mystery Solved Through Old Tape And Photo
content: The cold case, which involved Sturtz's strangulation after meeting her attacker at a bar on August 24, 1975, remained a mystery for decades.

title: Dravid Missing From RR Camp For IPL 2025 After Suffering Injury During...
content: Rajasthan Royals head coach Rahul Dravid was missing from their pre-season training camp ahead of the IPL 2025 due to injury.

title: NDTV Explains New Bill That Can Deny Foreigners Visas Over 'National Security'
content: Foreigners can be denied visas on national security grounds, their movements can be restricted, and they can be penalised for violating rules governing entry into, and exit from, India, according to a proposed law tabled by Home Minister Amit Shah.

title: NDTV Exclusive: Hunted Down, Massacred, Syria's Alawites Ask India For Help
content: Ali Koshmr, a 36-year-old man from Syria's Latakia, around 330 km from Damascus, woke up to the sounds of gunfire, tires screeching and dozens of armed men shouting, "Come out, you Alawite pigs, Nusayris!"

title: Congress, DMK MPs walk out of Lok Sabha over nod given to energy project along Pakistan border
content: Outside Parliament, the Congress rakes up the Adani Group’s alleged links with Mauritius-based shell companies; Prime Minister Narendra Modi is on a visit to the island nation.

title: Resolving the vexatious fishing dispute
content: Talks between the fishermen of India and Sri Lanka could pave the way for an agreement to put an end to bottom trawling

title: New eel species discovered off Thoothukudi coast named after Tamil
content: Fishermen who helped the National Bureau of Fish Genetic Resources in identifying the species wanted it named after Tamil Nadu

title: RSS-BJP workers illegally detain Tushar Gandhi
content: Protesters were reportedly irked by Tushar Gandhi terming the RSS a cancer on the nation’s soul in a speech commemorating the 100th anniversary of Sree Narayana Guru’s historic meeting with Mahatma Gandhi

title: Snake-bitten patients get a new lease of life at Kozhikode MCH
content: Seven patients each recovered in Jan. and Feb.; experts highlight the need for swift medical attention and awareness of venomous species

title: Telangana government forms Future City Development Authority; Hyderabad Metropolitan region expanded
content: FCDA will have in its jurisdiction over 765.28 square kilometres encompassing 56 revenue villages from seven mandals of  Ranga Reddy district, while  HMDA’s purview has been expanded to cover 10,472.723 square kilometres

title: Immigration and Foreigners Bill not connected to grant of citizenship, says official
content: The Bill is a comprehensive legislation to regulate all matters relating to foreigners and immigration that are currently administered through four Acts, which are proposed to be repealed

title: Telangana government forms independent experts panel to study socio-economic survey data
content: Eleven member Working Group to analyse and interpret the SEEEPC data and submit its report within one month

title: In Rajya Sabha, Trinamool calls for short discussion on duplicate EPICs next week
content: Opposition paused its protest in the Upper House on the issue of duplication of elector photo identity cards (EPIC) and the delimitation exercise for a day

title: Rajasthan CM announces recruitment to 26,000 posts, poverty-free village, and employment schemes
content: Rajasthan CM Bhajan Lal Sharma targeted the Opposition Congress on several issues, saying its leaders lacked the vision for development and were embroiled in “internal conspiracy”

title: Railways to dig ponds under Mission Amrit Sarovar to fight water scarcity
content: Officials told to desilt existing water bodies or construct new ones at sites close to railway tracks

title: Central officials hold meeting with Kuki-Zo, Meitei groups
content: The movement of commercial vehicles on National Highways Number 2 and Number 37 was blocked by Kuki-Zo protesters for the fourth consecutive day

title: Cab driver helps nab men ‘disposing of’ body in Kolkata
content: The deceased owed a large amount of money to the accused, and was unable to pay it, the police investigation found

title: Muslim MLAs will be thrown out of Bengal Assembly when BJP comes to power, says Opposition leader Suvendu Adhikari
content: Members of the Treasury Benches tabled a censure motion against Mr. Adhikari for the remarks he made after the suspension of BJP MLAs

title: Centre refuses to answer Rajya Sabha queries on Great Nicobar project clearances, saying it is sub-judice
content: Trinamool MP Saket Gokhale presses for answer, raises tribal concerns; Congress MP Jairam Ramesh says House is entitled to discuss anything except HC, SC judges’ conduct as per RS Chairman’s 2023 ruling

title: Parliamentary panel asks Centre to spend more on agriculture, rename Ministry
content: ‘Farm labourers, who often belong to marginalised communities, are a critical part of the agricultural workforce but are frequently overlooked in policy discussions and welfare schemes,’ the committee said

title: Congress and BJP members in the Lok Sabha call for unified action to tackle drug menace
content: Congress leader K.C. Venugopal underscored the devastating impact of drug abuse, particularly in his home State of Kerala

title: Popularise fortified rice scheme, House panel tells Centre
content: The panel hopes meticulous implementation of the scheme will eradicate malnutrition, improving the overall health and well-being of vulnerable populations

title: J&K L-G remits life imprisonment of three Jammu convicts
content: The authorities instructed the police to monitor their activities and warned that any violation will lead to the “cancellation of their remission”

title: Rajya Sabha debates working of Railways, Opposition slams privatisation of services
content: The Opposition placed a chargesheet against the Centre by citing frequent rail accidents and complaints about poor quality of services offered in trains due to privatisation

title: Design stage of small modular nuclear reactor completed:  Jitendra Singh
content: Once the project is sanctioned, it will take 60-72 months for the reactor to be constructed, Union Minister of State for Science and Technology Jitendra Singh informs Lok Sabha

title: IGNCA regional centre opened in Tiruchanur
content: The relics of Agastya Maharishi and his statue were brought from Varanasi and placed in an exhibition named as Agastya Maharishi Exhibition

title: Govt. not against conducting KAS prelims for third time, says Siddaramaiah
content: Candidates have challenged KPSC’s notification on the conduct of main examination before KSAT, which is expected to hear the matter today on Thursday

title: Sub-Registrars cannot register civil suit plaints and make them reflect in property encumbrance certificates, rules Madras High Court
content: Justice N. Anand Venkatesh says permitting such a process would only help trouble mongers to prevent landowners from dealing with their properties

title: Viveka murder case: Approver seeks tight security
content: As few key witnesses in the case have died recently, approver Shaik Dastagiri submits a letter to Kadapa SP requesting to beef up the security

title: Thalangara Thopi on the brink of extinction as last artisan halts production
content: The Thalangara cap was an essential part of Muslim attire, especially during the holy month of Ramzan. However, the demand has tapered off

title: DLSA orders Kalaburagi corporation to complete underground drainage works by Sunday
content: It comes in response to a petition filed by social activist Vaijnath Zhalki objecting to the inordinate delay in completing the works

title: Eight youths reported missing from different parts of J&K, say NC, PDP leaders
content: NC MLA tells Assembly of Poonch teenager who went missing after appearing from an exam; others reported missing from Kathua, Devsar, Ganderbal this year; five other missing people found dead in Kathua

title: Riyadh Air CEO in town for talks with Air India, IndiGo
content: India is a really important market; Riyadh Air will offer efficient connections back into India for many, says Tony Douglas

title: Subash Guttedar says ₹35 crore misappropriated under MGNREGA scheme in Aland taluk
content: According to the former MLA, the authorities are digging open wells in several GPs under MGNREGA using machines avoiding workers

title: Uncertainty continues over rehabilitation of Mundakkai-Chooralmala survivors
content: Most survivors are unhappy with the government’s rehabilitation plan; they allege that livelihood loss not considered by govt.

title: Women firefighters to ensure public safety during Attukal Pongala festival for the first time
content: The female officers have been deployed to ensure fire safety, shift devotees felled by heat exhaustion to hospitals, and provide emergency services within a 10 km radius of the temple

title: Protest over garbage dumping withdrawn on municipal commissioner’s assurance
content: Residents of various localities near Hosayellapur in Dharwad have taken exception to chemical fumes emanating from a landfill

title: Report suggests private mobility solutions to decongest Bengaluru
content: The report also recommends carriage licenses for non-commercial vehicles to promote shared mobility services like bike pooling and carpooling.

title: Future belongs to women, avers Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu
content: Stating that 75 women will enter the Legislative Assembly in Andhra Pradesh on completion of the delimitation exercise, Chandrababu Naidu asserts that women empowerment has begun with the emergence of TDP; to prove his point, he cites as examples the formation of DWCRA groups, provision of 33% reservation in employment and education, and equal property rights

title: Former U.P. top cop slams Sambhal DSP who asked Muslims to stay indoors on Holi
content: Senior retired police officials dubbed the statement as unlawful and stressed for action against Sambhal DSP Anuj Kumar Chaudhary

title: BJP likely to retain power in Belagavi as Mayoral polls are scheduled for Saturday
content: High Court stays disqualification of two members, Jayant Jadhav and Mangesh Pawar, on the issue of conflict of interest and office of profit

title: Polavaram diaphragm wall works going on: Minister
content: So far, 6,700 square meters of the diaphragm wall, spanning 136 meters in length, is completed, says the Water Resources Minister

title: Using only population figure as benchmark for delimitation exercise will do injustice to T.N., says DMK MP
content: The government should consider economic performance and vital indices such as GSDP, per capita income, infrastructure improvement and not just population while doing delimitation, says Kathir Anand

title: Karnatak University signs MoU with Universidad de Tarapaca of Chile
content: It is to improve further the quality of education through collaboration in academic and research initiatives

title: Tholur grama panchayat shines as Thrissur’s first garbage-free green panchayat
content: The initiative for making the panchayat free of garbage was implemented in phases under the ‘Thelimayode Tholur’ campaign

title: Uttarakhand HC grants bail to 22 accused in Haldwani violence
content: The violence took place after the district administration in Haldwani demolished a madrasa and a mosque as part of an anti-encroachment drive in February last year

title: ‘Absolute’ care in Govt. recruitment process is a must to keep public faith alive: Supreme Court judgment
content: Any chink in government recruitment processes would amount to a failure in public duty, a Division Bench observed

title: Prakasam police issue notices to Chevireddy Bhaskar Reddy
content: Five cases have been registered against the former MLA and YSRCP leader for alleged violations of the election code during the 2024 general elections

title: Man arrested for swindling money from mother of child sex abuse case accused
content: Fraud took place in multiple instalments under the pretence of funding legal expenses related to the case

title: IAF to get indigenous low-level transportable radars under Rs 2,906cr deal
content: Baby names that mean miracle 10 common Japanese words and phrases one must know In Pics: Rishabh Pant's sister Sakshi Pant to marry Ankit Choudhary 10 North Indian dishes that are perfect for a light dinner Nature’s most stunning bioluminescent life 8 reasons why every home must have a Money plant Madhuri Dixit Nene's gorgeous ethnic looks Balochistan: 9 things to know about Pakistan’s largest province From kaftaans to shararas; Hina Khan’s Ramadan inspired looks

title: Pound-for-pound rankings: Ankalaev is in, but what about Pereira?
content: ankalaev enters the top 10 for the first time on a pair of ballots . one voter has him in the top four, while another puts him near the bottom of the rankings . both light heavyweights -- former champ and current one -- are in the ESPN men's pound-for-pound top 10 .

title: NBA contenders don't fear the Thunder -- here are 22 reasons they should
content: "there's a certain seriousness that it takes to win in this league," says draymond green . "they haven't done it. And until a team does it, there's going to be a whole bunch of doubt," he says . doubters questioned whether Jayson Tatum and Jaylen Brown could win it .

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool's Mohamed Salah open to Barcelona move
content: manchester city have placed Eduardo Camavinga on their list of options for the summer transfer window . the 22-year-old hasn't decided whether he wants to leave Los Blancos and has a contract that runs until 2029 . rumours have sounded out Barcelona over a potential move .
